children.name: Has licence
desc: The number of files considered as legal (i.e. licences), as detected by Scancode.

children.name: Has contributing
desc: The number of files considered as a contributing or development guide, as detected by Scancode.

children.name: Has Readme
desc: The number of files considered as a readme, as detected by Scancode.

children.name: Code of Conduct
desc: The number of files considered as a code of conduct, as detected by Scancode. These can be any initiative and written document to regulate the behaviour of individuals
As an example, the Eclipse Foundation enforces the following code of conduct: https://www.eclipse.org/org/documents/Community_Code_of_Conduct.php .

children.name: Licences check
desc: Unwanted licences in the code, as provided by tools like ScanCode (or Black Duck or..).
All licences found in the codebase that do not conform to a custom regexp are considered wrong. One should have as few as possible of them.

children.name: Programming languages
desc: Number of programming languages detected in the code.

children.name: Authors
desc: Number of authors detected in the code.

children.name: Number of copyright holders
desc: Number of copyright holders detected in the code.

children.name: Number of copyrights
desc: Number of copyrights detected by Scancode in the code base.

children.name: Total number of files analysed
desc: Total number of files analysed (and documented) by Scancode. Metric is the number of files provided in the list of analysed files returned by Scancode.

children.name: Automatically generated files
desc: Number of files tagged as automatically generated, as detected by Scancode.

children.name: Special files
desc: Number of legal, license, readmes, manifests, copyright and other files for key, top-level files.
Key files are top- level codebase files such as COPYING, README and package manifests as reported by the --classify option 'is_legal', 'is_readme', 'is_manifest' and 'is_top_level' flags.
